spectrometer_visible.documentation: Spectrometer in visible light range diagnostic

spectrometer_visible.channel.documentation: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera)

spectrometer_visible.channel[:].active_s.documentation: In case of active spectroscopy, describes the spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices
Position of the centre of the spatially resolved zone
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Full width of the spatially resolved zone in the R, Z and phi directions
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_visible.channel[:].aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures

If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the center of the circle. If geometry_type=1, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.
Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system
Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"
Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2
Index in the error_description list for "radius"

Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is horizontal and oriented is the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_visible.channel[:].light_co.documentation: Light collection efficiencies (fraction of the local emission detected by the optical system) for a list of points defining regions of interest. To be used for non-pinhole optics.
List of positions for which the light collection efficiencies are provided
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Values of the light collection efficiencies
Index in the error_description list for "values"

Index in the error_description list for "spot_diameter"

spectrometer_visible.channel[:].type.documentation: Type of spectrometer the channel is connected to (index=1: grating, 2: filter)

spectrometer_visible.channel[:].type.ind.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

spectrometer_visible.channel[:].validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the channel for the whole acquisition period (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid)
Indicator of the validity of the channel as a function of time (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid)
Indicator of the validity of the channel as a function of time (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid)

spectrometer_visible.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

spectrometer_visible.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

spectrometer_visible.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

spectrometer_visible.detector_layout.documentation: Layout of the detector grid employed. Ex: '4x16', '4x32', '1x18'

spectrometer_visible.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

spectrometer_visible.ids_properties.comm.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

spectrometer_visible.ids_properties.crea.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

spectrometer_visible.ids_properties.homo.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0 or 1) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, this node must still be filled, and set to 1 (by convention).

spectrometer_visible.ids_properties.occu.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

spectrometer_visible.ids_properties.prov.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

spectrometer_visible.ids_properties.sour.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)
